problem.p:
A die is thrown twice. Let \(X_1\) and \(X_2\) denote the outcomes, and define
random variable \(X\) to be the minimum of \(X_1\) and \(X_2\). We will examine the distribution of \(X\).
How large is the outcome space corresponding to tossing a sequence of two die?
How many of these outcomes satisfy \(X_1 = 2\) and \(X_2 = 2\)?
How many of these outcomes satisfy \(X_1 = 2\) and \(X_2 >= 2\)?
How many of these outcomes satisfy \(X_1 >= 2\) and \(X_2 = 2\)?
How many of these outcomes satisfy \(min(X_1,X_2) = 2\)?
What is the probability \(X = 2\)?
What is the probability \(X = $x_min\)?
